title: One of the best mountaineering institutes in the world
review_text: Located in the hill station of Darjeeling, Himalayan Mountaineering Institute is recognized as one of the best mountaineering institutes in the world. It was established on 4th November 1954. The primary purpose of this initiative was to encourage, enhance and support the interest of the people in the sport of mountaineering; to channel the abundant energy of the youth into a productive and self-awarding sport. Aspiring mountaineers from all over the world come to this institute to develop their skills. Besides being one of the best mountaineering institutes in the world, the Himalayan Mountaineering Institute has become a significant tourist attraction on account of its picturesque setting in the hill station of Darjeeling. The magnificent view of the 8586-meter high peak of Kanchenjunga, the third highest peak in the world, from this institute is genuinely mesmerizing. More

title: Extremely interesting place with great historical value
review_text: You can visit the HMI as part of your Darjeeling Zoo ticket entry fee. It is definitely worth it! You can watch the youngsters scaling with ease the practice climbing walls on the way in, and then see the institute itself which, to this day, trains people from all walks of life in the skills it takes to become a mountaineer. The museum itself is an absolute gem. They have all the items of clothing and equipment from previous Everest expeditions along with newspaper cuttings and original letters of congratulations from officials for those who made it to the summit. It's incredible to see the evolution of climbing gear over the years. And you can buy some fabulous souvenirs of your visit at the museum shop on the way out, at a very reasonable price, before heading to the cafe for some momos or fried rice cooked by Nepali and Tibetan people who are friendly and accommodating. The museum was definitely a highlight of our trip to Darjeeling. More

title: Impressive views and climbing heritage museum.
review_text:
One of our first outings in Darjeeling was to a complex which houses the Himalayan Mountaineering Institute, Darjeeling Zoo and Natural History Museum. 

The first of these sites houses a college, museum showing exhibits from ascent attempts of nearby Everest and the tomb and memorial to the famous explorer Sherpa Tenzing Norgay. He lived in Darjeeling for much of his life and is associated with the town, it is from here that he planned and commenced his climb of Everest with Sir Edmund Hillary in 1953. It was fascinating to read about his life and work and see the esteem with which he is held in the area, really impressive stuff. 

It is around 100Rp to enter the site which includes all 3 attractions, the HMI, zoo and NHM. Cheap and well worth it family visit. More
